Reviews.Title: “Great weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: We had an oceanfront view and the view was nice. The room was nice and clean. The pool was nice. This place had an elevator which was nice as we were on the 4th floor. The water pressure in the shower was weak but overall I would say the room was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “This place is owned and run by scam artists”
Reviews.Author: spb5040
Reviews.Content: Two of my friends and I stayed at casablanca for only one night out of two booked nights. We got evicted on erroneous grounds. We were not partying nor drinking nor even playing music at all. We merely came back from Seacrets, attempted to enter the elevator area, yet were stopped because one of us didn't have a hotel card. Not everyone in a room needs a card we told the security guard. He let us in, yet followed us to our room. We said, sir I feel really uncomfortable with you following us to our room. This set him off. Words were exchanged, nothing about him nor race nor anything imflammatory. Yet, he kept saying, Ya'll evicted. Ya'll evicted. This was after AFTER we talked to our neighbors who the next day didn't say we were loud nor disturbed ANYONE when we talked to them. In the end, we got evicted and the security guard said, I own this hotel. We got evicted, fully charged for both nights even after being told at the front desk we were being charged our security deposit. Long story short, they evicted us under false grounds, took our money, only to rent out the room the following night. This place's security is outsourced by Bell Atlantic, whose employee acted in sheer dislike and disdain to us for NO reason. Management irresponsibly took our money and challenged us in court. Please do not feel comfortable staying at this hotel. I caution you.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a Scam”
Reviews.Author: summeraugust2012111
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Casablanca for a Friday and Saturday night in August 2012. Myself and two friends (all aged 25) booked a 2 bedroom suite that cost $496.32 for the 2 nights. We checked in at about 9pm, dropped off our stuff in the rooms and went out for the night. We returned to the hotel at 2am to go to sleep and this is where the problems began. To enter the hotel you must swipe a key card to get into the main lobby. Two of us entered the lobby, and my other friend was walking about a minute behind us and knocked on the door to let him in as he did not have a card key. We opened the doors to let him in and a security guard standing in the lobby told us we were not allowed to do this. We calmly explained to the security guard that he was a guest of the hotel as well. The security guard proceeded to harass us as we attempted to go to our room. He followed us all the way to our rooms, and as we went into our rooms he told us we were evicted from the hotel for being unruly and noisy. We laughed because this was clearly not the case, closed the door to our room, and went to sleep. At 4am, we awoke to knocking on our door. We opened it and 2 cops were there telling us that we were evicted from the hotel and had to gather our stuff and leave immediately. We asked why we were evicted and were given no explanation, and had no choice but to leave immediately and buy a hotel room elsewhere. The next day we went to the main office of the hotel in an attempt to talk to the manager, just to ensure we weren't charged $500 for a room that we never got a chance to stay in due to the eviction. The people working would not get a manager for us, but assured us that we would only be charged a $220 deposit we put down. The next week we checked if we were charged and found we were charged the full $500. We also checked sites reviewing Casablanca and found that other guests had been scammed the exact same way. I am writing this as a warning to all people considering staying here, especially if you are a young group of people, there is a good chance you will be scammed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “RED FLAG - DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: This place is GOD AWFUL. cockroaches everywhere and the security guard was a pervert who followed us to our room every night. The management was rude and couldn't speak a lick of English. Stay at the Holiday Inn instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean hotel, Great location !”
Reviews.Author: KumarRaj28970
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night in Mid-august of 2012. I arrived at around 12 noon, receptionist gave us parking pass (parking is across the street from property). We hanged around in the beach. This hotel is very close to beach. From some rooms you can actually see the ocean clearly. Boardwalk is 5 min walk and once you are in boardwalk, you can take a tram to go in the tram which takes you end-to-end. Rooms were clean and pretty comfortable for 4 adults and 2 kids. I booked deluxe efficiency. Room was freshly painted, furnitures were decent and there were enough towels, pillows, blankets etc. Every room has balcony. I noticed that you can hear noise easily from your neighbors. But if you are going mainly to beach and come only to sleep and keep your belongings this place is really great. I would definitely stay there again. Deluxe efficiency rooms had all the utensils and silverware to cook and eat. Perfect hotel for family

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: deevamf
Reviews.Content: Having been to Ocean City, MD many times in my life, I can honestly say that Casablanca Oceanside fits right in with the vast majority of other hotels/motels of its kind. Frankly, it's old, like most properties are. I go into each stay at a new place with that in mind, and don't expect the Ritz Carlton. With that said, Casablanca was definitely one of the better experiences that I have had. We arrived a couple of hours before the 3 PM check-in, but the front desk agents already had our paperwork ready to fill out. Even though we couldn't check in yet, we were allowed to fill it out early so as to make it easier when 3PM came. We also received a parking pass early, which allowed us to hit the beach for a few hours. At about 2:30, the skies darkened and it became clear that a storm was coming quickly. As we packed up our things to head to the car, the front desk staff actually called us to let us know we could check in early. Seriously, great service. Once inside, yes, the building was old. However, the room was plenty for us, and most importantly, was clean. The location is also great. It is on 25th, right off the boardwalk. I've stayed a number of times by the inlet, which seems to be where the crowds go in the evenings. With Casablanca being further down, we could walk to the inlet and enjoy the scene, but go back to the relative quiet of our hotel. I really preferred it. All in all, we would definitely stay at the Casablanca again. The price was very reasonable (for Ocean City), and all in all, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Christine H
Reviews.Content: I would like to start with the stench we encountered in the halls and elevator (which was broken on day 2 of our 4 day getaway.) We had to take the stairs, which smelled worse than the halls and elevator. Halls and Elevator were not air conditioned (it was in the 80's and 90's.) Room service was not very good. They came to clean at around 5 pm when I was taking a nap because we were out in the sun and surf the whole morning. When they did clean, they didn't replace the towels that we used.The beds were pretty much thrown back together. When I went down to the front desk to get more shampoo (there was only one with 2 double beds and a pull out couch there wasn't anyone there. Someone sneezed in the back, I said "God Bless You" and they still didn't come out. They kicked us out of the pool @ 8pm when the sign said 9pm. It put quite a damper on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain”
Reviews.Author: Klaura12185
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night over this past weekend w/ my husband and two of our friends in an oceanview room. The room was clean, the view was good though we weren't as close to the boardwalk as we'd like, but still it was adequate enough. Having a balcony is also a plus. The room was very clean, which for me, is a huge deal. The staff was very nice and allowed us to park our car in their parking lot prior to our room being ready which allowed us to get in some beach time. They also were courteous enough to call when our room was ready. Compared to the dive motel we stayed in last year (Suntan motel) this was definitely an upgrade. Only issue was that the elevator was out when we checked out, but it didn't bother us, as it was only 5 floors and we were walking down. Would stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation Stay”
Reviews.Author: rnbjkee
Reviews.Content: My Stay consisted of My wife and 2 sons(16,10) and me.We arrived early and they gave us a parking ticket to park in there parking lot.They then went out of there way to allow us to check in an hour early.When we got to our room we were VERY pleasantly surprised on how big, and clean it was.It had 2 beds and a sofa bed with a small kitchenette.It also has a private balcony which was big also overlooking pool.The noise level at night was low thanks to the staff keeping everyone in check.This is a family oriented,NOT a young party Motel.The staff was Excellent! They even scrubbed the pool chairs down every morning!We would Highly recommend this Motel to friends and family.We will also stay here again next year.Close to Boardwalk and alot of attractions,including Parks and Restaurants.Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, don't listen to bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: megansm1975
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were suppose to stay at a family members place for free when something unexpected happened and had to end up finding a place at short notice and had to pay. It was the Dew tour weekend so finding a place at short notice was nearly impossible, but Casablanca had vacancy. After reading some of the reviews I was hesitant but didn't have a choice. Let me just tell you, the reviews were way wrong! This was such a nice place to stay. It was clean and newly renovated rooms were very nice. We even had a problem with our door not opening and the staff was right on it and had it fixed. Would def stay again for another weekend!

Reviews.Title: “good location but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: kilarny
Reviews.Content: close to beach but not beachfront. older hotel small pool staff were nice. Room was a bit tired. small pieces of glass in carpet and rips in sofa. Overall hotel is ok if you get it at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Mini-vacation made perfect thanks to quiet location of Casablanca!”
Reviews.Author: dd26641
Reviews.Content: Recently my boyfriend and I booked a room for a mini vacation. For $165 we booked the Oceanfront King. We arrived earlier than expected, and the front deak staff allowed us to check in early. When we came into the room everything was perfectly clean and had a very "home" feel. The whole hotel was nice and quiet, and the staff was extremely polite! For as close to the beach it is, its a steal! The elevator starts to move sometimes before the door is closed, which is a little scary, but there's nothing wrong with taking the stairs. I would ABSOLUTELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: dodgingwrenches
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (30 y.o.) booked this hotel on Expedia because it was the cheapest available that had what we wanted (basically a roof over our heads and close to the Boardwalk). We were VERY pleasantly surprised by the hotel! Our room was HUGE for motel/inn standards and had a complete kitchenette and a living/dining area. We were very pleasantly surprised. The location was half a block from the boardwalk which was great, parking was across the street and free, and the staff was super friendly. We definitely got great value for what we paid for. The only downsides were: No internet access, only one slow elevator (horrible come check-out time), and the cleanliness left a bit to be desired. The elevator stinks like wet dog, bathroom drain had a bunch of hair in it, which made me gag, and the carpets need to be torn up and replaced with tile - seriously. Some reviewers complained that they couldn't party here, but for me, that is a big plus. If I wanted a college kids overrun hotel experience, I'd go to Florida for spring break. I really liked that the hotel is quiet and we got a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great time - Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: OCMD0012
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Casablanca Oceanside Inn for 2 nights with my girlfriend and her friend and we had a great time. This was our first time in Ocean City. The hotel is conveniently located near alot of great restaurants and night life. The hotel staff was friendly and very accomodating. There were only 2 drawbacks that I have to let other people know about. The first was the elevator. The elevator is so slow it's ridiculous. It also smelled really bad. The second drawback is the ice machine. There is only one ice machine and its located on the ground floor. By the time we were ready to go to the beach, around 10am, the ice machine was totally empty from everyone else filling up their coolers. Most hotels/motels have more than one ice machine. It wasn't a problem because we went next door to the Howard Johnson and used their ice machine! Overall it was a great trip and I would recommend the Casablanca Oceanside Inn to anyone looking for an inexpensive getaway. I would definitely stay there again. Oh yeah, and one more thing. My friend left an item in the room when we checked out. The staff called us immediately to let us know that they had secured the item for us but by that time we were well on our way back home and didn't want to turn around. They told us that UPS would pick up the item and deliver it to us in NY. I've gotta say that they were very professional, friendly and all around nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Please read if you are a young person planning a trip with friends.....”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl126
Reviews.Content: I just read another review which was written by a young person with a nearly identical experience, so I'm sure there are numerous guests who have encountered the same treatment by the staff at Casablanca. Last summer, a few of my friends and I went up to OC for a mini vacation before heading back to college. My friend booked this place online....BIG MISTAKE. Guests are not permitted into the hotel after 9 pm...which was not that big of a deal but it would have been great had they told us this before we brought friends back with us. We were also visited several times by a security guard who issued us a pre-eviction notice because of the noise complaints that another room had called in. Now either the walls in this place are paper thin or someone had hyper sensitive hearing because we had a visit from the security guard that night (which was a "warning" issued to us at 9:15 pm.... because I'm sure so many of our neighbors were trying to catch some beauty sleep at that hour). The pre-eviction notice came about an hour later due to our refusal to quiet down. We were unaware that sitting around a table and talking at a normal tone was a violation of the contract that we signed. Our drivers licenses (half of us were over 21) were taken to the front desk for some inexplicable reason, and my friend who was paying to stay at this hotel was excorted off of the property where he had to find another place to stay because we exceeded the number of allowed guests per room. Who knew? Luckily a friend was staying at a much friendlier establishment further up the boardwalk and he was able to stay in their room for a night. We thought about leaving Ocean City that night considering we were clearly not welcome by the staff at Casablanca (whom we were paying- don't forget), but decided to stay another night since that was what we paid for...in full...at check in. Rather than staying in, we headed to a few places on the boardwalk and visited various friends' houses. Luckily we avoided getting evicted on night 2...surprise! I would not go to the Casablanca Hotel if I was PAID to stay there another night. Apart from the unfriendly staff and the unreasonable "contract" that we apparently violated several times, the place was filthy. The rooms and halls smelled, the furniture on the balcony was broken, and the carpet and sheets were stained. We came to the beach for a relaxing two days and left angry and unhappy with our decision to even plan the trip. Please take this review into consideration especially if you are staying in this hotel with friends. Good luck :)

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT TIME AND GREAT PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: CHRISSY0059
Reviews.Content: there was a group of 10 of us that went down to oc from nj for the endless summer crusing car show from 10/9 thru 10/11 and we all stayed at casablanca. our ages ranged from 4yrs old to 60+ the rooms were awesome, very clean, staff was great! even the pool was open still! maid service was awesome...anything we needed she got it for us. great view of the strip so you could see all the cars and a 2 minute walk to the boardwalk. we just loved the location, you could walk across the street to embers all you can eat seafood buffet or the 7-11 which was so convient! needless to say we will all be staying here again for the next show!!!

Reviews.Title: “September get away”
Reviews.Author: theracefan
Reviews.Content: Casablanca Oceanside Inn. Went for the weekend 9/11 till 9/14. Read the reviews after I had already booked. We did not find any problems. Staff was friendly and gave us more towels when requested. Room was average but the sofa bed was a little worn out. The Kitchen area was good, A/C work well. We had 4 Adults and 2 pre teens. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “idk where you stayed but...”
Reviews.Author: steph1290
Reviews.Content: First of all, my friends and I decided last minute to go to ocean city. Most of my friends smoke so we spent our time looking for a hotel with smoking rooms, as well as something cheap. We came across this hotel on some website and booked it right away. After that I decided to look up some reviews since I had never even see this hotel before. I was shocked at some of the reviews I was reading. I called all my friends and told them some of the horror stories I had read. We were all freaking out, we were going to ocean city to get drunk and have a good time. Now, myself and my friends are not roudy college kids, who get drunk and cause chaos. We really only wanted a place to sleep, shower, and store alcohol. Now, we booked a room for 6 people- we had seven sleep in it 2 nights out of the 3. Apon our arrival we had to read and sign papers because we were all under 25. Also, we were told to have a 50$ security deposit in cash to be taken when we arrived, and we would have it returned when we checked out. They never asked for this, and we were all okay with that. We stayed on the 3rd floor. There were families and groups of kids staying here as well as us. The first night we were there one of the men in the room above ours threw up over the balcony. Not exactly the best welcoming you could think of, but we let it go. It never was cleaned up off the ground to my knowlege. Also, there were kids there who were extreamly loud, and got yelled at once. They were not evicited to my knowledge. We never had a problem with the managment or anyone in the building. The cleaning staff cleaned our room every day, and when we arrived it was clean too. We didnt use the dishes.. only the cups for drinks, and plastic cups for shots. The maid also washed our dishes everyday. All in all, for 6 college kids who were just looking for some fun, we had a good time, paying only about 100 a person for the whole weekend. It was really close to the beach, which we all loved. My boyfriend and I could take walks on the beach late at night and had no trouble. We had a good time, and I would come back and stay there with my friends again. The only downside... it was further down the boardwalk than we would have liked, but thats not a big deal. We walked, and it was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Fleabag”
Reviews.Author: outofthedriveway
Reviews.Content: This hotel, priced well over $200 a night, was filthy. The sheets were dirty and stained, the towels grungy, the bathroom wasn't even cleaned from the previous guests (toilet and tub were dirty). But the worst was there was spilt milk from a baby bottle under the bed (we didn't know) causing a horrible smell for our stay--it was nauseating. The hotels on the boardwalk were all full, so we were stuck. Management was quite unhelpful, and refused to refund any money. Don't get ripped off and stay at the Casablanca--it should be priced at about $29 a night. This is the worst hotel experience I have ever had, and I have travelled the world. Yuk!

Reviews.Title: “not a bad place to stay if your in college- not great for families!”
Reviews.Author: OhioMomof4boyz
Reviews.Content: First, when my family and I arrived, I was asked to pay in full, in advance, I DID NOT CARE FOR THAT AT ALL. I wanted the option to change hotels if needed. AND of course there was a need. We didn't know we we need two rooms, we did and they don't offer two rooms. Second, the screaming college/high school kids were really too much, I had call and complain about the noise at 1-2am. It just isn't a place for families. Also I didn't mind the cleaning people, when they showed up, if they showed up.There cleaning abilities leave something to be desired. When first got there in the room, we turn down the bed only to find a black sock popped out from underneath--eeewww. The other very bad thing was that it only had ONE elevator that was SOOOO slow. Also the fact that the parking lot is across the street- really was an inconvience, and it was small with small spots.... Ideally, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful desk staff”
Reviews.Author: casey4472
Reviews.Content: A big improvement over last year, must be under new management, how ever the desk clerk,Donna I remember from last year, very friendly, courteous and outstanding customer service, awesome employee

Reviews.Title: “good for the money”
Reviews.Author: eagles0931
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. The staff was very friendly, the cleaning crew was very nice and was more than willing to clean our room or give us new sheets (etc). We stayed in an efficiency room which was great. It came with full size fridge, microwave, sink and stove top (all the cooking utensils were provided). The balcony overlooked the pool which was nice. The location was great... steps from the boardwalk and near resturants and other attractions. From the outside looks old and in need of some renovations and has slightly small hallways but overall is a good stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell1016
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here over the weekend for the car show..looked nice when we first got there people were nice. My friend and i went to our room to relax before the night when she woke up she found about 4 bugs at firsts then took the sheets off to find more.. then i checked my bed and found some.. we called the office they came moved our room... i came to out new room to get something and found the orkin man and manager in my "new" clean room and they found more bugs. behind the headboard and ont he bed. we then moved to a 3rd room.. (all within 2 day) they offered us a free stay for our troubles.. NO dont think so ...u want me to come back??? NO sorry.. we then got all our money back.. but didnt really get to enjoy the weekend seeing there were bugs there! so if u can avoid this place ... i suggest you do!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the boardwalk & beach -- that's it”
Reviews.Author: sevnrock
Reviews.Content: What a terrible place. I know people need to venture a little away from the boardwalk scene to find a decent hotel, but this shouldn't even be considered an inn, hotel, motel, or whatever. 1. The rooms are nasty. It makes you wonder if they really clean it after someone uses it. 2. Pool is tiny and dirty. Enough said. 3. Staff -- oh man, you'll feel like you're in a prison when this place needs security! These guys roam the premise making sure the guests at this "inn" are not doing anything inappropriate. And they threaten to kick you out if they do not like what they see. Besides the close location to the boardwalk and beach, this inn has nothing more to offer. I recommend you look elsewhere -- a block down to Howard Johnson will probably be a better decision.

Reviews.Title: “"Caught Thief in the Act"”
Reviews.Author: Pa_AllieCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in "07" we enjoyed the ocean view & the price was right. Even tho the place wasn't very clean (& still isn't) and the elevator was scarey (it looks better this year) we decided to come back again this year...BIG MISTAKE!!! We returned to our room one day & realized someone had been in our room.The Do Not Disturb sign was on the door. We had left the radio on & it was off when we returned. We figured they came in to clean anyway. After looking around nothing had been cleaned. Two days later it happened again, this time the trash was pulled & towels left. (the Do not Disturb sign was on the door again) The next morning we were preparing to leave, we packed up most of our belongings and went down to load those items in the car. We knew it would only take us a couple of minutes to run back up to the room to get the last couple of items (a boogie board & a 3ft. piece of painted slate that weighted 40lbs. I bought at sunfest & the extra key card I left on the table.) We were parked on the side of the building so we decided to load the car out the back door. Then my husband parked the car in the back & I took the cart back to the entrance. When I returned to the lobby I saw my husband very upset yelling at the housekeeping guy. When I approached to see what was wrong I saw my slate painting ( that cost over $200.00) & the boogie board in his laundry cart. My husband came in the back door & caught him just before entering the employees only room.( I know we weren't even out of the room for 5 minutes) When my husband ask him what he was doing with our stuff he said he was taking it to the trash.( there was no trash in his laundry cart just our items & a couple of towels) When my husband got louder he said he was helping us. We took our things from him put them in the car & headed back to the room to get the key card I left on the table to find a housekeeper stripping the beds, the key card was gone. We didn't even check out yet! It was 10:20. I proceeded to the office to be met by a smug girl who was trying to act professional. (she was far from it) When I told her what had happened she said "well if it was in a trash bag he thought it was trash." ( I never told her it was in a trash bag) At this point I knew he already told her what had happened & she was covering for him. Then she said " some people aren't as intelligent as others" ...Well I don't care how stupid you are you don't pick up a 40lb. piece of painted slate with the price tag on it and think its trash! His only stupidity was he got caught! She said she was making a notation in the file & would inform the owner. She would take care of reprimanding him because that was her job. We should have called the police right then. We decided it wasn't worth the extra hassle we would have to deal with. Being so upset we just left. I could understand them being in the room if it was after 11:00 or we had checked out...but we didn't and that doesn't excuse the fact they had been in the room several times when the DO NOT DISTURB sign was on the door. After returning home we have found we are still very upset that this happened. I wanted to warn anyone concidering staying here what happened to us. I have also decided to contact the owners since I'm sure little Miss Attitude didn't inform them of what occurred. I think the owners need to do some housecleaning of there own!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Ceceily
Reviews.Content: We originally chose the oceanside view. We then recieved a phone call saying that it was not available but we could upgrade to a 2 bed efficiency with a poolside view at no extra charge. Well we were charged extra anyway and I didn't argue it too much because when i mentioned it, the girl on the phone got very defensive and it would of been my word against hers. She was not very pleasant. After arriving, I was glad that we didn't get the oceanside view, because it wasn't much of a view (view was between 2 buidings that sit behind the motel) and it was over garbage dumpsters which stank. It was clean but upgrades needed to be done. Things were outdated. This place needs to shell out a few bucks and do some decent upgrades, not just paint, which was done horribly. I don't think we'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Takes the Dump of the Year Award”
Reviews.Author: marianurse77
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, I read other reviews prior to arriving (but unfortunately after I booked). So I came prepared with a gallon of bleach, a huge bottle of spray disinfectant, and a huge tub of disinfectant wipes. Immediately upon entering the room, I noticed that the bathroom hadn't been cleaned in who knows how long. That isn't to say that grandma housekeeper for that floor didn't take a damp dirty rag and wipe off the surfaces. But the toilet was nasty, the bathtub was nasty, the floor was nasty. All of the dishes in the kitchen cabinets had food on them, including a can opener with caked on tomato sauce. The balcony had trash and a pop can on it, the AC unit had abount one hundred beer bottle tops. So I used 3/4 gallon of bleach in the tub and filled it with hot water, cleaned the toilet and sink with disinfectant and then used the remaining 1/4 gallon bleach on the dirty dishes after I washed them. The sofa bed had a huge spot of blood on the mattress. Since I noticed this at night, I went down and requested 2 sheets and an extra blanket with the idea that I would use the blanket in the closet first, then 2 sheets to cover the mattress and the extra blanket to cover up. I removed the blanket from the closet and discovered that it had blood also, as well as dried cheese all over it. So I had to request actually 2 sheets and 2 blankets. The next morning, my husband went down to the office and addressed our concerns with a dark-skinned female who became so loud and verbally abusive that my husband had to leave the office, as she was not allowing him to talk anyway. We were denied a refund. We were later asked to change rooms, but since I had already spent the first day of my vacation cleaning and sanitizing this room, there was no way in hell I would agree to do that. I asked them to just bring us another mattress for the sofa bed from a vacant room, clean the trash off the balcony and mop the bathroom. None of those things happened. The maid with blue hair came and wiped a few things and left. The same bloody mattress and probably the same trash on the balcony (I REFUSED to pick it up) can probably be found today. Then we were denied houskeeping services for the remainder of our vacation because the old grandma maid was insulted by our complaint. We went down twice and demanded someone come and take our dirty towels and we had to go down nightly and get new ones from the office. The pans were so scratched and rusted that I could not cook a meal. I requested a pot from them to cook pasta and they brought me a skillet (another very scratched one). Oh, back to the dishes...we were told that it is not their job to wash dishes, it is ours. We clarified this with them (we knew we had to wash our own) and they said that included someone else's dirty dishes that we found when we arrived. Because I spent the first day doing nothing but cleaning up from the previous tenants, we stayed an extra day. Manager N. gave us a whopping $30 discount on our final night due to the refusal of the housekeeper to check on our room our entire one week. Now that is really putting yourself out for terrible services there Miss N.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ocean view”
Reviews.Author: Pama72
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 stayed the week of 8/4/08, beautiful sunny week.....upon check-in (small office) the staff was FRIENDLY. The parking is across the street. We were able to obtain a key to change into swim suits prior to our room being ready, that's a +. However, this changing room/lavatory was dirty, the toilet was clogged and there is a vent that housekeeping could use to peek in on. Be cautious. We had 2 double beds, ocean view (AWESOME!!!), bathroom small (only big enough for one person @ a time, unless one is in the shower, bulb missing from 5 light fixture :( so it made the shower very dim.) Cheap tissues and 1 oz bottles of extra shampoo -I always bring my own anyway-.The refrigerator was a nice size but showed damage. Microwave served it's purpose. Air conditioning perfect. Small table with 2 chairs. No light by table. Only on nightstand. There was an additional 2 light fixture on the wall next to the bathroom, otherwise, dim lighting too. I would only recommend this room for a family of < 4!!!. The pool is nice but you only have about 4-6 inches between the edge of pool and the lounge chairs.dangerous with young children. it's VERY tight!! There were cigarette butts all over the place. I only ever saw the pool cleaned once with a vacuum and that was @ the end of the week. The first night's garbage sat in a garbage can outside our room, next to a soda machine for 2 days!!!!! The vending machines license expired in 4/08! Good ice machine! SMALL elevator. Point...the room was DIRTY; the balcony had sand on it, there was a bottle cap on the floor next to the refrigerator, under the room trash can I found a soda can tab, behind the night stand were crumbled papers and behind the tv stand was a note (8 1/2 x 11 paper might I add!!!) and some other crumbled papers. If it wasn't for the gorgeous weather I would not have been happy on this stay! Might stay again.?

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place if possible”
Reviews.Author: dawnyy23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some friends for a bachelorette weekend. The office staff were actually pretty nice but the place is a dump. Hallways, and stairwells smelled like mildew and there was some kind of disgusting slime on the concrete surrounding the pool. The room also had a bad smell- seemed to come from the refrigerator. Bedding and towels were thin and dingy, some of the towels and blankets had holes in them. Bathroom was just plain gross. And the noisy air conditioning unit kicked on and off every 10 minutes no matter what temperature we set. All in all an uncomfortable experience. Pay the extra money and stay someplace better.

Reviews.Title: “rude and dirty”
Reviews.Author: pix11
Reviews.Content: Very rude Manager and very dirty rooms .Will never even get close to that dump again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in O.C.”
Reviews.Author: absolutqt
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay here feeling slightly nervous after having read many of the negative reviews. I'm happy that I didn't let my nervousness keep me from giving this place a try. Check-in was quick and everyone was pleasant. I made my reservation by phone and when asked what floor I wanted to be on, I told the gentleman, "Just give me whatever you think is best." He put us on the 5th floor and I'm VERY happy he did. Tons of college aged kids on the first floor and from what we gathered from other folks staying there, it could get pretty noisy when the clubs let out and kids returned to their rooms. We didn't hear a peep of that on the 5th flr. And the management clearly states that they will not tolerate bad behavior as we saw evidenced by the police escorting kids from the property who'd been fighting. The room itself was spacious, the air conditioner was plenty cold. We had a deluxe efficiency and were happy to have a full sized fridge, microwave, coffee maker and even two stove top burners which allowed me to easily prepare baby's formula and a basic breakfast! I never had any problem with hot water but hubby tried to take a shower in early evening and complained that the water was cool...I chalked it up to everyone returning from the beach at the same time and all showering for their night out. The pool was small (we really didn't use the pool) but the beach was so convenient that we didn't need to. If it's luxury you want, you will be disappointed but if you want a place close to beach with reasonable rates , this is for you. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jc76virginia
Reviews.Content: my family and i stayed at the casablanca oceanside inn .It's a nice place to stay ,and convenent to the beach and boardwalk. We had no problems what so ever .the room was clean .The office staff was very nice. I'd stay there again. .

Reviews.Title: “Rude nasty people and smelly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jerseybella84
Reviews.Content: the front desk AND THE MAIDS ALL HAD ATTITUDES! they all were TROUBLEMAKERS because they didnt like us for some reason. they were all RACIST! the hallways smelled like OLD BUTTER.... our ocean view was RIDICULOUSLY CHEESY I SAW LIKE 5 INCH OF OCEAN AND THE REST WAS COVERED BY A BUILDING... and it was expensive! i hated it and would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Management refused to talk to me!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JennStebbins
Reviews.Content: There were tons of issues with the room. Bugs, dirty sheets (if you can imagine the worst thats what we got), hair all over the place in the shower and bathroom. Went to the front desk to try to talk to the manager. The front desk lady came back saying that the manager didn't want to talk to me and wouldn't do anything to resolve the issues. If I could rate lower than terrible on here I would.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room, perfect view”
Reviews.Author: canda11
Reviews.Content: Upon reading reviews about a neighboring hotel and getting grossed out, I decided to check out other area hotels. I was leaving in less than a week, and my boyfriend and I desperately needed a place to stay. I stumbled upon the casablanca's website and thought it was perfect for us. It was. I could see how the other reviews were complaining about lack of ocean view, but our room was perfect. Oceanview, boardwalk view, private balcony. We were very happy with the staff, the cleaniness, the room etc.. There really is a complaint worth mentioning. When leaving I asked if we can request that same room for the following year, and they happily agreed as long as the dates co-inside with theirs. Also, when calling to make reservations, the rates they told me over the phone were cheaper than the rates posted on their website. This definately solidifed my choice and again was very happy and will absolutely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, very nice price.”
Reviews.Author: kimmie34
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel online, while looking for a hotel in ocean city, maryland. Online price 90.00 plus tax for a thursday late august. I called directly to make sure they were a half a beach block from the beach, and asked about the price. They quoted me 59.00 tax included. I BOOKED IT DIRECTLY! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our first impression was that we had robbed them, because we were expecting a run down place. It was very nice and clean. The pool was clean with plenty of chairs for everyone. The one elevator was busy, but we didn't care.. we were on vacation! The room was clean and the bathroom very nice. A lot of hot strong water was available and plenty of towels. The rug in our room had a small tear in it, but we didn't care, we were on vacation. Donuts and coffee in the lobby in the morning were nice. Truly a half a block from the beach with safe parking across the street. If you want a ocean view, ask for 5th floor facing the beach! The room deck was clean and had a clothes stand for drying. The A.C. was cold and the tv worked fine. For a simple clean time in ocean city... stay here! The location is at the start of the boardwalk, just 2 blocks shy, and you can ride the tram all the way down and back. Super time. AAAA++++

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be...”
Reviews.Author: gd500
Reviews.Content: First, this is how the place used to be. It used to be simply outdated in decor but very clean (including pool) with nice staff and reasonable prices. This is how it was during our last stay. The carpet was stained, a bi-fold closet door (1 of 2) was missing, the foundation on one bed was broken, there were just a couple of spoons and knives and two bowls, the ceiling above the tub had mildew, the tub insert was broken, the soap dish above the bathroom sink kept falling off, and finally the pool was in disrepair including a broken ladder and missing tiles. The price keeps going up and things are worse than ever. The staff was OK this year. My family and I have stayed here several times over the last 10 years but I am sorry to report that it is not worth it any longer. For the money I expect at least a clean room in good repair.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad”
Reviews.Author: EarLle
Reviews.Content: Close to beach and boardwalk. Quiet rooms and hotel. Quiet area. Staff is friendly. Nice size room. Nice size kitchenette with full size refrigerator. Nice bathroom. Carpet was nice, but needed to be cleaned and vacuumed. Nice furniture in room. Nice dinette set, but bottom of chairs were dirty. TV could had been positioned in a different spot, more in dinette/living area, not sleeping area. Walls were a little dirty. Holes were in walls. Pictures in the our room were nice. Good size balcony. Elevator is fast, but there is only one elevator and the door can close on you fast. We only saw one ice machine on the first floor. Locks on front door of room work, but had to work with it, and there was no top latch. Was no Do Not Disturb sign in our room. Our beds in our double room was not for anyone taller than 5'6". Parking lot across the street. Office is not in hotel, outside in little building. If this hotel fixes its little problems, it will be an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: PKH926
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying here. We also stayed in 2005. We have never had any problems. Our parents stayed next door and their AC wasn't working properly. It was a Sunday evening when they called the front desk. They said that they would have someone over to fix it. They put a new AC in within a couple hours. The check in and check out went smooth. The space in the rooms are nice and the location is good. Never had any problems with the hot water. We had a first floor room. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place for the price and area”
Reviews.Author: polkamikes
Reviews.Content: Reluctantly booked this motel for the price and area and was a little afraid after reading some of the reviews. Overall we (family of 6) were very pleased with the motel and the friendly staff. They even called when we got home to see if I forgot something in my room. The price was very good for the location. Will probably stay there next summer also.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth Your Money”
Reviews.Author: ReeciePeicie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Casablanca Oceanside Inn this past week with my mother and aunt (July 18-22) and while there was nothing horrible about the hotel... the price definitely reflected the location and not the hotel quality. The first thing we noticed was the handwritten note on loose-leaf paper in the middle of the mirror when we arrived. In summary it said "If you do what I say and tip me we will get along just fine, Love the Housekeeper. DO NOT REMOVE". Needless to say we removed the note from the middle of the mirror we paid for and intended to use and stuck her note to the dresser so that her next tenants could have the pleasure of reading it as well. Our room was an efficiency and we would often leave our dirty dishes or utensils in the sink to was when we returned.... To our surprise we would come home and the housekeeper would have done them, which was very nice and would lead you to believe that the rest of the room was just as clean... Not so much. I do not think our room was vacuumed once (being at the beach this is easy to detect). We always had new towels and our beds made everyday which was nice and expected. Overall, the hotel served its purpose and there was nothing about it that we entirely disliked or that disgusted us. We went in knowing it would be a cheap beach motel for sleeping purposes only, and that is what we got. I would not recommend paying for this hotel…or any of the beach front properties in Ocean City for that matter unless you have money to throw around or can find one for under $100 dollars. The way that this Beach City is set up, it seems that there are many hotels/condos for rent that are not directly on the beach, but are definitely within walking distance. All activities (The boardwalk, food, mini-golf and grocery) also seem to be in walking distance from wherever you stay as this place is very over developed. Ocean City was a great experience and the Hotel served its purpose, but I probably would not recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Umm... The Owner is an Not Very Nice Person.”
Reviews.Author: Tetch7
Reviews.Content: Okay... So my friend booked the room... I read the reviews on Tripadvisor after he told me where we were staying. Needless to say, I entered into this weekend venture with no expectations. The room was an efficiency... it was not bad... for the price he paid for the weekend. It was myself, my best friend, her fiance and our other friend. I had gone down to the ocean the second evening, and because a bunch of people were on their balconies yelling... the owner decided he'd evict our room. He didn't evict all the rooms, just two. I honestly believe he does this b/c he can re-rent the room and make more money... We had a bad experience... I WASN'T EVEN IN THE ROOM AND HAD TO LEAVE! All in all, this place is a "dive", and definitely a party motel... If you're looking for somewhere cheap to stay... I'd probably have to say go for it... but if you're looking for a lovely weekend, no way. It's a shady little place, with cheap decorations and cheap bathrooms (the drainage in the tub is horrid)... But hey, you get what you pay for... So I'd recommend this place to the younger crowd and say, go for it... b/c how much time do you spend in your room when you're at the beach anyway?

Reviews.Title: “nasty dirty stinky mold infested run down place”
Reviews.Author: dawnangel21
Reviews.Content: this place was horrible the rooms were very dirty and stunk very bad trash under the bed mold everywhere in the bathroom it looked as if the celing was ready to fall down couldnt even let the kids get a bath made them stand in the shower and not thouch anything while i washed them off old dirt and hair on the floors very dirty toilet aslo very dark green walls nasty balcony cigarette butts in a dirty ac tray broke chairs on balcony and sheets had stains on them elevator and hallway very dirty and stinky, wet floors thruout,dirt stained carpet the maid lady was nice but i would be nice to if i didnt have to do any work and not to mention the parking lot was on the other side of a crazy highway with no crossing lights and this isnt oceanfront its oceanside

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: lindsay_D2007
Reviews.Content: Disgusting place. We are currently staying here and our room is filthy. There are foot prints on the walls, stains on the sheets, and sand in the rug. The bathroom was also pretty dirty. There is no remote for the t.v.'s. The front desk could not find one for us and we also heard another guest asking for a remote, so it's not just our room. The whole hotel smells dirty. Plus, the parking lot is on the other side of the main road. Our balcony faces the alley that is full of trash, so our balcony smells like garbage at all times. This place is a total slum. I would avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: NYShonna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casablanca May 17-20 2007 and we had a great time. The check in was very fast and everyone at the hotel was nice and friendly. We booked a poolside efficiency and the room was very spacious and clean. I can't believe how clean our room was from reading the other reviews. Casablanca is a very nice place and I would recommened it to other people

Reviews.Title: “Really, it was fine for the price and location.”
Reviews.Author: ihearteurope
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here, my sister informed me that we had made reservations at the Bates Hotel. I was nervous. We are travelers, and we stay in hotels at least once a month, usually not less than 3 stars. We were looking for a place for our annual girls weekend (we are all in our 20s and 30s), and for the price and location, this seemed great. We had an efficiency room that was clean and more than adequate. The full sized refridgerator was quite an asset. The sheets were clean, the beds and pillows were comfy. Towels were scratchy and thin, but hey, this was a budget hotel. It was crowded with college aged kids, which we expected. The pool was not entirely in the sun and pretty small, so we avoided it. We were only one hotel behind being directly on the sand, and it was very convenient. None of us ever felt put out by running back to the room for snacks or the restroom. We never experienced the hot water problem other people talked about here. We did find that the flushing capacity of the toilet was low, so be sure to use less toilet paper than you're used to. I would totally recommend this hotel for your stay. The price was great, the location was great, and the staff was willing to do whatever you needed.

Reviews.Title: “Insane Reviewers”
Reviews.Author: TheFest
Reviews.Content: The people who rated this hotel with 1 or 2 stars must never have traveled to Ocean City, or any other shore town for that matter. My fiancee and I booked one night for Memorial Day weekend. Having traveled during Memorial Day weekend to various East Coast beaches, I knew that the previous occupants on Friday and Saturday would have been a bit rough on the room. Fortunately, if they were, all traces were removed by the hotel staff. Listen, the rooms weren't the nicest in the world. I wouldn't eat off the carpet or choose those comforters for my house. I'm sure rooms like that exist somewhere in someone's imagination at these prices. In my many years of shore travel, it doesn't happen that way. You want luxury, spend twice as much. I had an ocean view balcony for less than she and I spent on lunch and dinner. What more could you ask for? The TA reviewers need to change their diapers and get a grip. Additionally, I found the staff to be pretty nice in all my dealings (reservation, check-in, check-out, housekeeping). I automatically give hotels a +1 star when reading the reviews on this site simply because people are such whiners.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: katie21488
Reviews.Content: We stayed from May23-25 2007. We had a wonderful vacation. The room was nice and clean and the staff was very nice. We were expecting it to be horrible from some of the reviews but it turned out the oppostie and we plan to go back in august. the only bad thing about it was it was quite a walk to the end of the boardwalk abd the elevator was a little dirty but other than that it was worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware Of This Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Harley2003
Reviews.Content: Beware---Of The Casablanca Oceanside Inn So You Are Not Stuck Like We Were !!! Stay At The Tidelands Caribean Same Moneis !!! We booked this hotel for Sun July 16-19, 2006 a double effy. with a sofa bed for 5 people. $185.00 pr-night discounted rate through Hotels.com regular rate $209.00. TOTAL $628.83 We paid for it on our credit card and was confirmed with an email from Hotels.com-with confirmation of 3 adults --2 children for Sun-Wed. I called the Casablanca Oceanside Inn on Friday 7/14/06 and talked with a woman at the front desk and confirmed our room 2 double beds--stove-ref-sofa bed and # of people in our party-smoking- ocean view--pool--confirmed late check in between 8-9PM-- We left on Sunday late afternoon heading for Ocean City for a family vacation. I called the hotel at 8:30Pm talked with a gentleman and told him we were going to be there around 9:30PM--He said Okay your room is secured and paid with a credit card.... Well were we SHOCKED we found the hotel on 24th St. we had to park next door at the Howard Johnson’s Hotel just to check-in we went in the office it was run-down and I asked to see the room before we checked-in. The guy gave us the key to our room and we went to look at it--the elevator floor had water all over it-- a hazard waiting with cermic tile when it is wet--but we overlooked it we were TIRED after driving 5.5 hours.. We got off the elevator to bright Mint Green walls painted-hallway had a musty smell and dirty floors--We proceeded to our room and opened it up and thought $185. Pr-night for this--the web site shows NICE rooms they were okay at best a little run down ..We could not see the ocean from our room we could see a concrete bldg behind us. The balcony overlooked the pool BUT I was leery of letting my kids swim in...But I figured they could swim in the ocean. We went to check-in and make do with what we had--IT WAS LATE -I asked about parking they told us across the street in a parking lot--( I thought we would have fun unloading and then trying to crossing 2 lanes of traffic...) Then they tried to charge us $120.00 extra plus tax of 9% because there was 5 of us. I questioned them pretty hard and showed them our email from Hotels.com showing 5 total people in our party and said we paid for it on a credit card you accepted payment and I called etc . to verifty just 1 hr. ago--they would not let us check-in they said Hotels.com did not tell us everything etc...after 15 mins of getting NO WHERE but them half laughing at us---I requested to talk with the Manager of the site they called her and she was RUDE and told us if we did not pay the monies we did not have a room. It is listed on their own web-site the extra charges etc... if we did not stay we would be subject to a cancellation policy of 1 night stay of $185.00 plus $25.00 fee Charged to our credit card----I told her no way were we paying this extra money and we already paid for this room with Hotels.com at a discounted rate--she hung up on me. ---- I asked the front desk to use their phone and I called our credit card company and put the charges into dispute right there on the spot--the one guy was half laughing and said they still would still charge it it was their policy.. We left the hotel and sat in a parking lot on a cell phone with Hotels.com they WERE GREAT and understanding !!!!!!!! They refund all of our monies after calling the hotel itself and verifying the events that took place and then the Casablanca said we could come back and they would not charge us the extra money- I told Hotels.com no way they were laughing at us and were VERY RUDE and the hotel is not worth the money--Hotels.com said that is not their policy once you pay for a room their are no future monies due at check-in.. We tried to use Hotels.com to find us another hotel nothing was available for Sun. night at this point it is now 11:40PM. We drove around checked 3 hotels and FINALLY found a hotel at the Tidelands Caribbean Hotels and Suites on 4th St. we stayed there and had a WONDERFUL ROOM--A king size suite with kitchen for the same monies if we would of paid the extra monies that the Casablanca wanted. BEWARE !!!

HotelInfo.Name: Casablanca Oceanside Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2408 Baltimore Avenue, Ocean City, MD 21842
